metadata.dc:author: Benoit, M
Jordá, E
Mascaró, J M
metadata.dc:description: A case of congenital granular-cell epulis is reported. This tumor is most frequent in females and it grows in the incisive part of the gum. Histologically it is characterized by large eosinophilic granular cells in a very vascular stroma. The surface epithelium underlying the granular cell proliferation is not hyperplastic.
metadata.dc:title: Epulis congénito de células granulosas
[Congenital granular cell epulis].
